title: React/JSX-curly-brace-presence is too strict
body:
In the case below: ```jsx
Hello world!
``` The linter throws an error for using curly braces, but it's impossible to have multi-line parameters without them, as the template literal notation (``string``) requires curly braces to be used. `eslint --fix` produces the following result: ```jsx
Hello world!
```

title: How to avoid "Assignment to property of function parameter 'elem'"
Set import/extensions to ignorePackages
body:
This allows to import non-JavaScript files through the main export of a dependency's package.json.

The following would trigger an error before, but is fine with the new configuration:

```js
import 'roboto-fontface';
```

title: Added the website
body: Added the website I made in the "The JavaScript Style Guide" section on line 3581 and deleted repeated word "Guide" in the section title on line 3578.  See issue #1650 for more information on the website.

title: JS Style Guide Website
body:
### Hello,
This style guide is very useful, however, it can be hard to read and use on Github, so, I have turned it into a website listed below, using @surge-sh:

[http://js-styleguide.surge.sh/](http://js-styleguide.surge.sh/)

I would love to update it as the README is updated, and would love if someone made me a contributor in order to do so quicker. Also, I plan to add the other Airbnb style guides soon. As of now, I had to take out the table of contents and links to the top of the page, but it still works fine. Hope this helps people and if someone would like to help out that would be great. 

Pictures:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23295246/33533969-8ac13504-d872-11e7-850f-ddada6dd5979.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23295246/33533996-bbc1f2f6-d872-11e7-843f-e94ba5400e57.png)

title: one-const is incompatible with destructure rule
Add 'to' as a specialLink to the 'anchor-is-valid' a11y rule
body:
Support React Router's `<Link to="...">` attribute out of the box.

Fixes #1647.

title: ESLint 'anchor-is-valid' rule interfering with react-router-dom
body:
```
    'jsx-a11y/anchor-is-valid': ['error', {
      components: ['Link'],
      specialLink: [],
      aspects: ['noHref', 'invalidHref', 'preferButton'],
    }],
```
The current configuration will cause `<Link to="/route" />` to be marked as invalid, as it does not have an `href` attribute. Internally, the `Link` component will transform the `to` prop and render an anchor element that does have an `href`.

`to` just needs to be added to the `specialLink` array. 

I'd be happy to open a PR if everyone is okay with this change.

title: What are the risks of mixing shorthand properties with valued ones?
body:
The BOM PR is still on my todo, don't worry. I hope it's ok to ask the next explanation nonetheless, becuase I just found another part I don't understand. As for rule 3.5 "Group your shorthand properties…" it states:

> Why? It’s easier to tell which properties are using the shorthand.

What's the benefit thereof? Why is it important to see what's shorthand? What are the risks of mixing them?

title: enable import/order in eslint-config-airbnb-base
body:
Enable the rule "import/order"
This is a breaking change and if accepted will have to wait for a major

title: Explain UTF-8 BOM rule in readme
body:
Most style decisions are explained in the readme, but I couldn't find the reasoning on why a BOM is considered bad. Where I've looked:

* [the patch](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/commit/d9cb343b518349982f3b094f2ce48eda8347e6c7) that enabled it, found no commit message body.
* the current code of the rules file, https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/8cf2c70a4164ba2dad9a79e7ac9021d32a406487/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/style.js#L472-L474
* [the eslint rule page](https://eslint.org/docs/rules/unicode-bom) mentioned in the patch code comment, doesn't claim it's bad.
* searched the readme for "BOM", "unicode" and "byte order"
* searched issue tracker for "BOM", "unicode" and "byte order"

Could someone explain it, or add search keywords to make the explanation easier to find?

Update: Also, is there a recommendation on how to declare the file encoding instead? I searched the readme for "charset", "encod" and "character set" but no matches.

title: Add staticContext to list of no-param-reassign "ignorePropertyModificationsFor"
body:
The property `staticContext` is passed to react-router components during server-side-rendering, and assignment to properties in this object is used to convey information to the server, e.g. response status codes.
 
https://reacttraining.com/react-router/web/api/StaticRouter/context-object

Would you be willing to add `staticContext` to the list of OK params to reassign?

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/blob/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/best-practices.js#L174

title: Ambiguous 'good' example
body: 7.11 uses the 'bad' example from 7.1. Changed to arrow function to prevent ambiguity.

title: 7.11 good example uses bad example from 7.1
Add .mjs extension support
body:
Fixes #1634 following what I think was @ljharb's intent, as per [his comment here](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/1592).

- [x] Add `.mjs` to the list of supported extensions
- [x] Forbid `.mjs` extension from being specified

title: Support .mjs extension
body: When using [ECMAScript Modules](https://nodejs.org/api/esm.html#esm_ecmascript_modules) in node, ESLint complains because the config doesn't yet support the `.mjs` extension.

title: Unexpected use of file extension "jsx" for "./components/App.jsx" (import/extensions)
